dt: {bc}a male child from birth to adulthood

dt.t: Author Kyle Lukoff told {it}Newsweek{/it}, {it}Call Me Max{/it} and other books in the series are about a young trans {wi}boy{/wi} figuring out who he is, making new friends, and sharing about himself with his family and community.
Even though it made them uncomfortable to have their {wi}boy{/wi} talked about all over town, secretly, Nick's mom and dad were pleased.

dt: {bc}a man or boy native to a given place
used interjectionally to express intensity of feeling

dt.t: Now, the receiver is getting a second chance, thanks to old friend Tom Brady. "Tom is my {wi}boy{/wi}," [Antonio] Brown said Wednesday during his introductory video press conference in Tampa.

dt: {bc}a male domesticated animal and especially a pet

dt.t: Leo is a 2-year-old pit bull mix. … He loves receiving attention, getting pets and being told he is a good {wi}boy{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a male servant or an enslaved man
used to address a man of color and especially a Black man
The deeply offensive use of the word {it}boy{/it} to address an adult man of color has a strong association with sense 5a and is a term expressive of racist condescension.

dt.t: My favorites … are the {wi}boy shorts{/wi}. I find that they're long enough to give me the coverage that feels right for me and the aesthetic I'm looking for, but they're short enough that they don't bunch up under pants or ride up throughout the day.

dt.t: A long time ago she married a man who turns out, by his own admission, to be somewhat dishonest—not a killer, not a dope peddler, but no {wi}altar boy{/wi}, either.
